required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Modulating Prefrontal Circuits Underlying Behavioral Flexibility in OCD: A TMS Study
clinical_study.official_title: Modulating Prefrontal Circuits Underlying Behavioral Flexibility in OCD: A TMS Study

brief_summary.textblock: This study investigates whether slow-frequency repetitive transcranial magnetic stimulation targeting frontal pole can acutely modulate brain circuits which show abnormal functioning during behavioral flexibility in obsessive-compulsive disorder, as well as performance on a behavioral task.

primary_outcome.measure: Change in regional activation in orbitofrontal cortex
primary_outcome.time_frame: Before rTMS and within 30 minutes immediately following rTMS
primary_outcome.description: Change in task-based regional activation (assessed via functional magnetic resonance imaging; fMRI) in orbitofrontal cortex

primary_outcome.measure: Change in regional activation in dorsolateral prefrontal cortex
primary_outcome.time_frame: Before rTMS and within 30 minutes immediately following rTMS
primary_outcome.description: Change in task-based regional activation (assessed via fMRI) in dorsolateral prefrontal cortex

primary_outcome.measure: Change in regional activation in anterior cingulate cortex
primary_outcome.time_frame: Before rTMS and within 30 minutes immediately following rTMS
primary_outcome.description: Change in task-based regional activation (assessed via fMRI) in anterior cingulate cortex

secondary_outcome.measure: Resting-state functional connectivity with ventral striatum
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Before rTMS and within 30 minutes immediately following rTMS
secondary_outcome.description: Resting-state functional connectivity with ventral striatum (assessed via fMRI)

secondary_outcome.measure: Resting-state functional connectivity with dorsal striatum
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Before rTMS and within 30 minutes immediately following rTMS
secondary_outcome.description: Resting-state functional connectivity with dorsal striatum (assessed via fMRI)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Before rTMS and within 30 minutes immediately following rTMS
secondary_outcome.description: Behavioral performance on a cognitive flexibility task (% trials correct)

arm_group.description: Participants with OCD who receive active rTMS
Participants with OCD who receive sham rTMS
Healthy control participants who receive active rTMS
Healthy control participants who receive sham rTMS
